Hi! Ask me anything about SQL.
SQL stands for Structured Query Language. It is used to store, retrieve, and manage data in relational databases.
DDL stands for Data Definition Language. It is used to define database structure. Commands include CREATE, ALTER, DROP, TRUNCATE.
SQL stands for Structured Query Language. It is used to store, retrieve, and manage data in relational databases.
ALTER modifies table structure. Example: ALTER TABLE students ADD age INT;
DROP deletes a table permanently. Example: DROP TABLE students;
TRUNCATE removes all records from a table without deleting its structure.
DML stands for Data Manipulation Language. It includes SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.
SELECT retrieves data. Example: SELECT * FROM students;
INSERT is used to add new records to a table. Example: INSERT INTO students VALUES(1,'Amit',20);
INSERT adds data into a table. Example: INSERT INTO customers(name, city) VALUES('Rahul','Mumbai');
UPDATE changes data. Example: UPDATE students SET age=21 WHERE id=1;
DELETE removes rows. Example: DELETE FROM students WHERE id=1;
DCL stands for Data Control Language. It includes GRANT and REVOKE.
GRANT gives privileges. Example: GRANT SELECT ON students TO user1;
REVOKE removes privileges. Example: REVOKE SELECT ON students FROM user1;
TCL stands for Transaction Control Language. It includes COMMIT, ROLLBACK, SAVEPOINT.
COMMIT saves changes permanently.
ROLLBACK undoes changes since last commit.
SAVEPOINT sets a point to which a transaction can be rolled back.
Primary Key uniquely identifies each record.
Foreign Key links one table to another.
JOIN combines rows from multiple tables based on a common column.
Normalization is the process of organizing data to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity.
Normalization divides large tables into smaller ones and links them using relationships to avoid duplicate data.
Aggregate functions perform calculations on data, like COUNT(), SUM(), AVG().
Bye! Keep practicing SQL
Goodbye!
